response: Heart attacks can have symptoms like chest pain, shortness of breath, and nausea. If you suspect a heart attack, seek medical help immediately.
High blood pressure (hypertension) increases the risk of heart disease and stroke. It's important to monitor and manage it.
High cholesterol can lead to heart disease. It's important to maintain healthy levels through diet and medication if necessary.
Regular exercise is crucial for maintaining heart health. Aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate exercise most days of the week.
A heart-healthy diet includes plenty of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins while limiting saturated fats, trans fats, and sodium.
Smoking is a major risk factor for heart disease. Quitting smoking can significantly improve your heart health.
Chronic stress may contribute to heart disease. Finding ways to manage stress, such as through relaxation techniques, can benefit your heart.
Diabetes can increase the risk of heart disease. Managing blood sugar levels is essential for reducing this risk.
Maintaining a healthy weight is important for heart health. Obesity can increase the risk of heart disease and other health conditions.
Adequate sleep is vital for heart health. Aim for 7-9 hours of quality sleep per night to support overall well-being.
